FuncDef: The display aaa abnormal-offline-record command displays the abnormal logout record. The display aaa normal-offline-record command displays offline records for normal logouts. The display aaa offline-record command displays offline records. The display aaa online-fail-record command displays online failure records.
CLIs: display aaa { offline-record | online-fail-record | abnormal-offline-record | normal-offline-record } { ip-address <ip-address> | ipv6-address <ipv6-address> } nop
display aaa { offline-record | online-fail-record | abnormal-offline-record | normal-offline-record } { pevlan <pevlan-id> [ cevlan <cevlan-id> ] } nop
display aaa { offline-record | online-fail-record | abnormal-offline-record | normal-offline-record } { pevlan <pevlan-id> [ cevlan <cevlan-id> ] } [ count <count-value> ]
display aaa { offline-record | online-fail-record | abnormal-offline-record | normal-offline-record } { ip-address <ip-address> | ipv6-address <ipv6-address> } [ count <count-value> ]

display aaa { offline-record | online-fail-record | abnormal-offline-record | normal-offline-record } { domain-name <domain-name> | slot <slot-id> | username <username> | interface { { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } | { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } { pevlan <pevlan-id> [ cevlan <cevlan-id> ] } } | user-type { bind | admin | none } | mac-address <mac-address> } * [ count <count-value> ]

display aaa { offline-record | online-fail-record | abnormal-offline-record | normal-offline-record } { domain-name <domain-name> | slot <slot-id> | username <username> | interface { { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } | { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } { pevlan <pevlan-id> [ cevlan <cevlan-id> ] } } | user-type { bind | admin | none } | mac-address <mac-address> } * brief

display aaa { offline-record | online-fail-record | abnormal-offline-record | normal-offline-record } { domain-name <domain-name> | slot <slot-id> | username <username> | interface { { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } | { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } { pevlan <pevlan-id> [ cevlan <cevlan-id> ] } } | user-type { bind | admin | none } | mac-address <mac-address> } * nop
display aaa { offline-record | online-fail-record | abnormal-offline-record | normal-offline-record } { ip-address <ip-address> | ipv6-address <ipv6-address> } brief

display aaa { offline-record | online-fail-record | abnormal-offline-record | normal-offline-record } [ time <string-value> <string-value> [ date <string-value> <string-value> ] ] brief [ reason | include <include-text> ]
display aaa { offline-record | online-fail-record | abnormal-offline-record | normal-offline-record } [ time <string-value> <string-value> [ date <string-value> <string-value> ] ]

display aaa { offline-record | online-fail-record | abnormal-offline-record | normal-offline-record } { domain-name <domain-name> | slot <slot-id> | username <username> | interface { { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } | { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } { pevlan <pevlan-id> [ cevlan <cevlan-id> ] } } | user-type { bind | admin | none } | mac-address <mac-address> } * brief reason | include <include-text>

ParaDef.Info: Queries the records of users in a specific domain. The value is a string of 1 to 64 characters. The value is not case-sensitive.

Indicates the specified user name according to which the logout record is queried. Only the first 32 characters are adopted. The value is a string of 1 to 253 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.
Displays brief information of the records. -
Displays records for a specified IP address. This value is in dotted decimal notation.
Displays records for a specified IPv6 address. The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.
Displays records about a user. During record displaying, you do not need to enter Y or N to check whether to display the next record. -
Displays the records for normal logouts of users from a specified VLAN. It is valid for Ethernet interfaces only. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4094.
Displays the records for normal logouts of users from a specified QinQ VLAN. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4094.
Saves a specified number of user login failure records. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65536.
Queries the records of users on the board in a specified slot. The value is a string of 1 to 15 characters, which is not case-sensitive, spaces not supported.
Queries the records of users on a specific interface. -
Specifies the interface name. -
Specifies the interface type. -
Specifies the interface number. -
Queries the records of users of a specific type. -
Queries the records of users of bind authentication users. -
Queries the records of users of administrators. -
Queries the records of users of unauthenticated users. -

Queries records of a user with a specific MAC address. mac-address specifies the MAC address of a user. The value is in the format of H-H-H. An H contains 4 hexadecimal numbers. The value is a 12-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of H-H-H. Each H is 4 digits. If an H contains fewer than 4 digits, the left-most digits are padded with zeros. For example, e0 is displayed as 00e0. The MAC address cannot be set to FFFF-FFFF-FFFF.
Specifies the start time. The value is a string of characters in the format of HH:MM:SS, which indicates hour:minute:second.
Specifies the end time. The value is a string of characters in the format of HH:MM:SS, which indicates hour:minute:second.
Specifies the start date. The value is a string of characters in the format of YYYY/MM/DD, which indicates year/month/date.
Indicates the reason why a user fails to go online or goes offline. -
Specifies a character string to match a user. The value is a string of 1 to 256 case-sensitive characters, spaces supported.

Examples: User offline reason: DHCPV6 client release
Are you sure to display some information?[Y/N]:y
User offline reason: User request to offline
Are you sure to display some information?[Y/N]:
User offline reason: User request to offline
Are you sure to display some information?[Y/N]:Y
ExtraInfo: Usage Scenario You can run the preceding command to view abnormal logout, normal logout, logout, and login failure records of users. If no condition is specified, abnormal logout, normal logout, logout, and login failure records of users are displayed. After you run the display aaa { abnormal-offline-record | offline-record | normal-offline-record | online-fail-record } command, abnormal logout records are displayed if such records exist, regardless of whether you have run the undo aaa { abnormal-offline-record | offline-record | normal-offline-record | online-fail-record } command. In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
msg: Error CLI:display aaa { offline-record | online-fail-record | abnormal-offline-record | normal-offline-record } { domain-name <domain-name> | slot <slot-id> | username <username> | interface { { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } | { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } { pevlan <pevlan-id> [ cevlan <cevlan-id> ] } } | user-type { bind | admin | none } | mac-address <mac-address> } * brief reason | include <include-text>
